titleStmt.title: Fancy's freedom. Or The true lovers bliss Exactly set forth in the faithful and constant affection of a gentlemans daughter, who fell in love with her fathers serving-man, she having a thousand pound left her by an uncle, and how they were married (notwithstanding all opposition) and liv'd happily to their hearts content. In spite of fate true love shall crowned be and wear a garland for its loyalty. Tune of, Amarillis, or, Phillis on the new made hay, &c.

Fancy's freedom. Or The true lovers bliss Exactly set forth in the faithful and constant affection of a gentlemans daughter, who fell in love with her fathers serving-man, she having a thousand pound left her by an uncle, and how they were married (notwithstanding all opposition) and liv'd happily to their hearts content. In spite of fate true love shall crowned be and wear a garland for its loyalty. Tune of, Amarillis, or, Phillis on the new made hay, &c.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for W. Whitwood at the Golden-Lyon in Duck-Lane,

notesStmt.note: Verse - "All in the west of England fair".
Place of publication from and date conjectured by Wing.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
